title: Forward/Transparent Proxy
description: A forward proxy is an Internet-facing proxy located on the local organizational network used to retrieve data from a wide range of sources (in most cases anywhere on the Internet) on behalf of clients located inside the local network.
key-ideas: Positioned in front of client devices.
Makes network requests on behalf of local devices, also masking the internal IP addresses and port numbers.
Can be used to break-and-inspect SSL traffic (such as HTTPS) enabling deep inspection on otherwise encrypted connections.
Can provide data-loss prevention capabilities, anti-virus, anti-malware, anti-spam, and web-filtering.
Can also cache frequently requested data in order to quickly serve the data to internal clients.
